name: Push-up Lat Row
steps: Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders, and your feet hip-width apart.
Perform a push-up by bending your elbows and lowering your chest towards the ground.
Push back up to the starting position.
Lift your right hand off the ground and pull your elbow up towards your ribs, bringing your hand towards your shoulder.
Lower your right hand back to the ground and perform another push-up.
Lift your left hand off the ground and pull your elbow up towards your ribs, bringing your hand towards your shoulder.
Lower your left hand back to the ground and perform another push-up.
Repeat the exercise for 2-3 sets of 10-12 repetitions.
comments: Keep your core muscles engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability.
Keep your elbows close to your body during the push-up and row portions of the exercise.
Keep your neck in a neutral position and your gaze focused on the ground to avoid strain.
Use a lighter weight or no weight to start with and gradually increase weight as you get stronger.
Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the exercise.
Remember to alternate sides and maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
